title: 1978 Pontiac Firebird

description: This 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am 2 Door T-Top  (
Stock # P10311
) is available in our Pleasanton, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at
or by email at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
Simply Breathtaking 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am T-Top

New to our Pleasanton showroom is this simply breathtaking 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am 2 Door T-Top with black exterior paint, gold graphics/badging and a black vinyl interior.  Under the hood you’ll find a heavily modified factory 400 cid V-8 engine with the numbers matching automatic transmission, plus this one comes equipped with cold A/C, cruise control, power steering/windows/doors, power brakes, premium wheels and more.
Please note that this classic vehicle is not emissions compliant under California law and it is not eligible to be registered within the state.  Check with your local DMV for further details.
Only 2,000 Total Miles on Factory Rebuilt Drivetrain

In terms of condition, this 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am is well above the typical driver standard with gorgeous paint and an ultra-straight body, a very clean interior and of course the nicely sorted engine compartment.  The engine work was completed within the last 2,000 miles as well so this one sounds like a champion and should have many great years ahead of it.  Everything else on this ’79 Firebird is super-nice- this is one of the most impressive examples we’ve seen in quite some time.

While this beauty is still technically a numbers-matching classic, you can see from the photographs that extensive work has been done to the engine.  We do not have any DYNO testing on file so we don’t know how much power it’s putting out at the wheels, but we can tell you that it’s very quick and a great overall muscle car.  It does everything well with a great feel on the open road.
Fantastic Overall Condition Both Inside & Out

Overall, you’ll find that this 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am T-Top is in investment grade condition and ready to enjoy immediately by a performance enthusiast.  With recent interest in this model recently topping an all-time high, now would be the perfect time to add this spectacular muscle car to your collection.  For more information about this vehicle, visit our Pleasanton, California showroom, give us a call at
, or email us at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
title: 1979 Pontiac Firebird

description: 1983 PONTIAC FIREBIRD TRANS AM  VIN  1G2AW87H3DN218556    215-631-1776    BLACK EXTERIOR  CARAMEL TAN LEATHER BUCKET SEATS  T - TOPS  355 CID RAMAIR SBC V-8 502HP@7000RPM 400 FT/LBS  DOUG NASH 5 SPEED CLOSE RATIO MANUAL TRANSMISSION  AIR CONDITIONING  POWER STEERING  POWER 4 WHEEL DISC BRAKES  POWER WINDOWS  POWER DOOR LOCKS  POWER MIRRORS  AM/FM/CASSETTE STEREO  TILT WHEEL  EPSILON MODULAR 16X9 WHEELS  GOODYEAR 255/50 ZR 16 RADIALS  CLEAN NO ACCIDENT CARFAX  ODO:  8331 (ACTUAL MILES UNKNOWN)    If you think this is just another Trans Am    THINK AGAIN!    OLD FORGE Motorcars is proud to offer this amazing magazine feature Trans Am.  Purchased new the owner was disappointed in the Pontiac's performance and driving dynamics compared to his Ferrari Boxer 512, so he built his Trans Am to be comparable to his Ferrari.  Copies of the magazine article comparing his 2 cars from Sports Cars of the World are available by calling Friendly Wayne at 215-631-1776.  We will not respond to email requests.      The owner started by replacing the anemic factory installed Chevy 305 with a Danny Jesel built 355 with a roller tappet cam and aluminum heads.  Dynoed a 502hp @ 7000 rpm, the recommended redline is 8500 rpm!  0-60 time 3.5 seconds quarter mile 11.80 sec@120.5 mph.    The car was sent to Ed Moran for a complete suspension rebuild using Herb Adams VSE suspension as the base - the result is a Trans Am that rides similar to a factory produced car but one that handles and corners much better.  The build took in excess of 1000 hours, the result is amazing.    Our multi-point inspection gives this beast a thumbs up except for the aftermarket 220 mph odometer/speedometer which is not working correctly.    Rest assured this Trans Am is second to none in performance and driving dynamics -- you will love it!    $19900    Friendly Wayne  215-631-1776    CLOSE OFFERS CONSIDERED   As with all the cars we offer, we encourage independent inspection.   WE ARE ALWAYS LOOKING FOR COLLECTOR CARS    PLEASE CHECK OUR 100% POSITIVE EBAY FEEDBACK AND BUY WITH CONFIDENCE
title: 1983 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am

description: It's hard not to get excited about this 1969 Pontiac Firebird convertible.  There's been great care and investment in taking pride in originality from the brown paint to the fantastic gold interior.  But more than just appearance, the numbers-matching 400ci V8 and four-speed manual means this drop top is also a rapid ride.

This car's original style is the key to its charm.  That's why it's still wearing its factory-correct code-61 Espresso Brown.  But you might notice it a little more.  There was a nice investment in making sure a respray stayed with the factory color, and adding a newer white electric folding roof.  The result is a factory-like presentation that has the allure of a modern shine and crispness.  It's this kind of originality with subtle upgrades that you will see elsewhere, too.  The design of these first-gen cars really lived up to the Firebird name, with a beak-like nose and slotted sheetmetal that looks like a bird in flight.  It's an icon that looks best when complete.  That's why trim, dual scoop hood with proper 400 badges, Firebird side marker lights, and Rally II wheels are essential to this well-represented droptop.

Perhaps most remarkably, the interior is completely original.  Not only does the code 202 Gold vinyl upholstery look great against the Espresso Brown paint, but it is in fantastic condition. Sure the seats have a few signs of people sitting in them over the years, but you can still slide behind the wheel of this Firebird for a long trip without complaints. Carpets, door panels, and even the steering wheel are untouched 1969 pieces and the burled walnut appliques on the dash and console haven't been baked by the sun. Original gauges still show clear lenses and bright markings and the factory AM/FM radio still lives in the center of the dash... and yes you get an 8-track â€“ it's that original.  Even Hurst shifters were available on the Pontiacs back then.  But once again, the theme of subtle upgrades is seen with the oil pressure and engine temperature gauges are nice additions to know everything that's going on with this Firebird.

On a car this original so far, you're going to be excited to lift the hood.  Not only is that the numbers-matching 400 cubic-inch powerplant inside, but also everyone will have no trouble believing it, too, thanks to the honest appearance of the engine bay.  If you do look a little closer, you'll see performance upgrades like a Holley four-barrel carburetor, Edelbrock Performer intake, and long tube headers.  So you get a great original presentation to show off, but an extra wallop of power for the road.  You can here this added power through the dual exhaust, and you're in complete control of it all with the four-speed manual transmission.  This performance Pontiac also feels great on the road thanks to features like power steering and BF Goodrich tires.
Complete with Pontiac Historic Services (PHS) documentation, this is truly an intere

Great addition to any Pontiac or GM Collection!  Pontiac...Catch the excitement!
title: 1969 Pontiac Firebird

description: Pontiac was still in the performance business when this 1976 Pontiac Firebird Formula 350 was built, complete with a 350 cubic inch V8, making it as much fun to drive as it is to look at. The market is moving on these cars, and this high-visibility example still carries its matching-numbers drivetrain.

Recently repainted in its original color combination, this Firebird is exactly the opposite of subtle. Forget all the jokes about flying chickens on the hood, because this one has a clean, chiseled look that suggests horsepower without the added graphics. It was a clean, honest car before the repaint, too, and has ended up as an ultra-sharp reminder of what performance was like in the '70s. Gaps are good all around, and Pontiac gave it a great look with a modest chin spoiler, a pair of hood scoops, and a ducktail spoiler out back, all of which remain in excellent shape. The paint is two-stage urethane, so it has a great shine that's virtually indestructible, and the black lower edges emphasize the length of the car, making it long and low. It's not perfect, of course, but it's got an awesome look that'll stand out among all the Trans Ams you see at shows.

White buckets were the best way to travel in 1976, and the classic color combination ensures that this Poncho will always be in demand by collectors. The seats are comfortable and supportive thanks to fresh foam underneath, and the seat covers themselves are exact reproductions that show very little wear since the restoration. The center console houses the original shifter for the TH350 3-speed automatic transmission as well as a handy storage bin, and the gauges look quite good considering their age. The original AM radio is still in the dash, but today entertainment comes from an AM/FM/CD stereo head unit neatly stashed in the glove box. The trunk is highly original and includes the original mat which is a bit tattered but these days, originality matters.

While a lot of engines were down on horsepower in the mid-70s, Pontiac engineers were better than most at keeping their top engines at the top of the horsepower charts, and the 350 cubic inch V8 in this Firebird is a good runner. This is the original, numbers-matching engine and runs great, so it's ready to enjoy without worries. It wears Pontiac Turquoise paint, a Rochester 2-barrel under the original air cleaner, and an all-new exhaust system with a high-flow catalytic converter and transverse muffler. The chassis is in good order thanks to a lifetime in the south, and a set of reasonable gears in back make it an effortless cruiser. Wheels are the traditional Pontiac Rally IIs which have been painted to match the body and wear 235/60/15 BFGoodrich radials at all four corners.
Five years ago, we told you that this day was coming, and now it's here. '70s Firebirds are red hot and climbing the market faster than almost anything else. Don't wait another day, call us now!
title: 1976 Pontiac Firebird

description: Up for sale we have a rare find. This is a Two Owner 1979 Pontiac Trans Am Anniversary Edition Trans Am. I purchase this car from the original owner years ago, and am the second owner. Numbers Matching 403V8 that has been rebuilt (less than 500 miles on it), new carb, mild  cam installed. It has the original transmission, rear end etc. All Numbers Match from when it was purchased in Red Bluff CA in 1979. We had the car professionally repainted to original specs. New decal kit also installed. All brand new very expensive interior professionally done. New brakes, dual exhaust. A/C redone with new compressor and lines. Brand New Bluetooth Stereo with speakers and Amp mounted in the trunk. This car is meant to be driven. Paint was done about 4-5 years ago and looks amazing. It has always been inside my shop and has never been driven in the rain. The undercarriage is completely rust free. There are no patch panels or rust repairs anywhere. All original metal/doors, trunk etc. It was stored inside prior to us getting it as well.  You wont find a cleaner body especially at this price. Everything was professionally done and nothing but Legendary or OEM products used. Only thing left to do is get the original rims redone (I have all four)  A/C and heater both work. All original California Smog equipment is intact.  Miles are believed to be original but we are not 100% sure due to age of car.Any questions please call me directly (707) 999-8429 - Chris - DLR#86285Clean California Title in Hand. Original build sheet also present and in the folder with tons of receipts.

description: For sale in our Chicago showroom is this beastly 1986 Pontiac Firebird Trans-Am.  Originally, these 3rd generation F-bodies would have had a 305, or sometimes the more powerful 350.  This example has had a built 355 transplanted into it making it a real screamer.  With a 4-speed automatic transmission controlled via a B&M shifter, you are in full control of scooting this Firebird right along.  With an estimated 350-375 horsepower at the crankshaft, this red rocket will rip through 1st gear and chirp hard going into second.  DonÃ¢??t want to hit it stoplight to stoplight? No problem!  This baby shifts smooth and firm when you arenÃ¢??t pedal to the metal.The body of this Firebird is well travelled having seen about 204,000 miles, but the engine has right around 60,000 on it after being transplanted into this beauty.  A fresh coat of red was applied to keep the car looking like new.  The interior has been kept up over the years and looks like it was just dropped in the car.  The windows roll up and down with ease, the gauges are all easy to read and in plain sight, and the seat put you in a real comfortable pose for cruising.With all this power on tap in such an unsuspecting ride, you are sure to catch a few people off guard in this Ã¢??86 Pontiac Firebird.  Options include: AM/FM/CD, Cruise Control, Power Brakes, Power Steering, Power Windows, Tilt Wheel, and Racing Wheels.  For more information on this Ã¢??86 Pontiac Firebird, contact our Chicago showroom at (708) 444-4488 or Chicago@GatewayClassicCars.com.  To see more HD photos and an HD video of this vehicle running and driving, please visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com.

description: For sale in our Dallas showroom is a hotrod from yesteryear. A beautiful 1968 Pontiac Firebird. Built to rule the strip or street the big and littles tell the story. With a big cam and a four speed this car was built to make noise and jam gears all while making the pavement pass by in quick order. The Pontiac 350 CID V8 puts out the power that makes the Mickey Thompson drag radials necessary. The Crane Cams .536 lift give the type of idle that strikes fear in those that oppose you on the tarmac. The paint and body on this car is something to behold as the Sunburst Red paint is as smooth as you can get and looks fantastic. The red interior is all nostalgia in factory red. Get into the driver seat, fire up the engine, grab the shifter, and set your rpms via the hood mounted tach and GO! Good first gen Firebirds are hard to come by and this is one that you donÃ¢??t want to miss. The features include AM/FM radio, Power Steering, Seat Belts, Vinyl Interior, Radial Tires, and Aluminum Alloy Wheels. For more HD pictures and video visit http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/dallas/1968/pontiac/firebird-S438.html. For more information call our Dallas showroom at 817-310-9400.
